e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because it promotes transparent and honest financial reporting. Although investors are currently aware of the bias, this practice may still expose the company to legal liability or regulatory scrutiny. By switching to unbiased reporting, the company can reduce this risk and demonstrate a commitment to accuracy and fairness in its financial disclosures.
e5: I would view a reporting policy as ethical if it is transparent, accurate, and unbiased. The policy should clearly communicate financial information to stakeholders without intentionally omitting or distorting material facts. Additionally, the policy should be applied consistently and not changed arbitrarily to influence market perceptions. Considerations pertinent to the context include ensuring that all stakeholders have equal access to financial information, avoiding practices that may disadvantage certain investor groups, and being mindful of regulatory requirements and industry standards for financial reporting.
e6: Yes, I would ask follow-up questions. Specifically, I would like to know how the management team plans to communicate the change in policy to investors and stakeholders, what measures will be taken to ensure a smooth transition, and whether any additional steps are being considered to further enhance transparency and accuracy in financial reporting.
